Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.util.FileUtil

  • public class FileUtil
extends Object
    Utilities for working with files

        public static final Comparator<File> LIST_FILES_COMPARATOR

        public static PrintWriter openForWriting(File file)
        Opens a file for writing in the default encoding. Wraps the Writer in a BufferedWriter and PrintWriter for efficient and convenient access.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to open
        Returns:
        write interface into the file

                                         String encoding)
        Opens a file for writing. Wraps the Writer in a BufferedWriter and PrintWriter for efficient and convenient access.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to open
        encoding - the encoding to use, e.g. "utf-8"
        Returns:
        write interface into the file

      • processTree

        public static void processTree(File root,
                               FileUtil.FileTask task)
        Perform an operation on all files in a tree. Sorts the files alphabetically, with directories first, so they are always processed in the same order.
        Parameters:
        root - the directory to start in (all subdirs are processed)
        task - the task to execute for every file

      • processTree

        public static void processTree(File dir,
                               String glob,
                               boolean recurseSubdirs,
                               FileUtil.FileTask task)
        Perform an operation on some files in a tree. Sorts the files alphabetically, with directories first, so they are always processed in the same order.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to start in
        glob - which files to process (e.g. "*.xml")
        recurseSubdirs - whether or not to process subdirectories
        task - the task to execute for every file

      • findFile

        public static File findFile(List<File> dirsToSearch,
                            String pathToFile,
                            List<String> extensions)
        Find a file, searching several directories and trying several extensions. Searches the first directory for the file name with each of the extensions, then the second directory, etc. Will only find a file if it is really inside the directory, so e.g. passing ../../etc/passwd won't work.
        Parameters:
        dirsToSearch - directories to search for the file
        pathToFile - file name or path to the file (without extension if extensions != null)
        extensions - extensions to try, or null if the extension is already in pathToFile
        Returns:
        the file if found or null if not found

      • addNumberToExistingFileName

        public static File addNumberToExistingFileName(File file)
        Add a parenthesized number to a file name to get a file name that doesn't exist yet.
        Parameters:
        file - the file that exists already
        Returns:
        a file with a number added that doesn't exist yet

      • listFilesSorted

        public static File[] listFilesSorted(File dir)
        Returns files in a directory, sorted. Sorts alphabetically, case-insensitively, and puts subdirectories first.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to list files in
        Returns:
        the sorted array of files

      • globToRegex

        public static String globToRegex(String glob)
        Convert a simple file glob expression (containing * and/or ?) to a regular expression. Example: "log*.txt" becomes "^log.\*\.txt$"
        Parameters:
        glob - the file glob expression
        Returns:
        the regular expression
